meanings.definition: To make (something) known to the public.
meanings.sent1: The company is publicising their new product through social media.
meanings.sent2: She is publicising the event by putting up posters around town.
meanings.sent3: The magician publicised his disappearing act to the audience.
meanings.sent4: The sun publicises its presence by shining brightly in the sky.
meanings.sent5: Publicising important information helps people stay informed.

meanings.definition: The action of making (something) known to the public.
meanings.sent1: Publicising plays a crucial role in marketing strategies.
meanings.sent2: The publicising of the new policy caused a lot of discussion.
meanings.sent3: The publicising of the surprise party almost ruined the surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a beacon of publicising joy in the room.
meanings.sent5: The publicising of the news spread quickly through the town.
